page.title: 13Conservation,Marston Thrift
page.content: In the north-west between Marston Moretaine and Cranfield is an area of old woodland known as Marston Thrift.This mixed deciduous wood was coppiced for Hazel up to the beginning of the 2nd World War.After the war about 40% was cleared and replanted with conifers.The remaining 60% was unattended except for shooting rights.About 10 years ago the Beds and Hunts Wildlife Trust acquired the rights from the Forestry Commission,who themselves leased the wood,to manage the area for Nature Conservation.This area is also a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI). South of Marston Thrift is the ditch around the northern and western edge of the clay pit.This is an area of specialized plant and animal life-a mass of Coltsfoot in the Spring,and is to be safeguarded from restoration.
